feed.title: RustSec Advisories
feed.subtitle: Security advisories filed against Rust crates

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0028: Unsoundness in cve-rs
entry.summary: cve-rs introduces memory vulnerabilities in safe Rust
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0028

cve-rs introduces memory vulnerabilities in safe Rust
Reported
February 10, 2025
Issued
May 5, 2025
Package
cve-rs (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unsound
Categories
  • memory-corruption
Keywords
#soundness-hole
References
  • https://github.com/Speykious/cve-rs
Patched
no patched versions

Description

cve-rs allows you to introduce common memory vulnerabilities (such as buffer overflows and segfaults) into your Rust program in a memory safe manner.

Internally, this crate does not use unsafe code, it instead exploits a soundness bug in rustc: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/25860

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

no patched versions

Description

totally-safe provides unsound APIs that exploit a soundness bug in rustc: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/25860

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0030: Unsoundness in totally-safe-transmute
entry.summary: totally-safe-transmute allows transmuting any type to any other type in safe Rust
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0030

totally-safe-transmute allows transmuting any type to any other type in safe Rust
Reported
February 10, 2025
Issued
May 5, 2025
Package
totally-safe-transmute (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unsound
Categories
  • memory-corruption
Keywords
#soundness-hole
References
  • https://github.com/ben0x539/totally-safe-transmute
Patched
no patched versions

Description

This crate uses a known soundness issue (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/32670) that will never get fixed. In short, Linux provides a file called /proc/self/mem which can be used by a program to modify its own memory. This library modifies an enum variant number by accessing its own memory as a file to effectively transmute a variable.

See also https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/os/unix/io/index.html#procselfmem-and-similar-os-features

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0027: Unsoundness in mp3-metadata
entry.summary: Panic in mp3-metadata due to the lack of bounds checking
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0027

Panic in mp3-metadata due to the lack of bounds checking
Reported
April 28, 2025
Issued
April 30, 2025
Package
mp3-metadata (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unsound
Categories
  • denial-of-service
References
  • https://github.com/GuillaumeGomez/mp3-metadata/issues/36
Patched
  • ^0.4.0
Affected Functions
Version
mp3_metadata::read_from_slice
  • <0.4.0

Description

The get_id3() methods used by mp3_metadata::read_from_slice() does not perform adequate bounds checking when recreating the tag due to the use of desynchronization.

Fixed in Fix index error, released as part of 0.4.0.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0026: registry is unmaintained
entry.summary: registry is unmaintained
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0026

registry is unmaintained
Reported
January 13, 2025
Issued
April 29, 2025
Package
registry (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unmaintained
References
  • https://github.com/bbqsrc/registry-rs/commit/41dc296c786e5943d3238535e45e1df60b258050

Description

The author has archived the GitHub repository and mentions deprecation in project's README.

Possible alternatives

  • windows-registry

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.

entry.title: RUSTSEC-2025-0025: rustc-serialize is unmaintained
entry.summary: rustc-serialize is unmaintained
entry.content:
History ⋅ Edit ⋅ JSON (OSV)

RUSTSEC-2025-0025

rustc-serialize is unmaintained
Reported
April 28, 2025
Issued
April 28, 2025
Package
rustc-serialize (crates.io)
Type
INFO Unmaintained
References
  • https://github.com/rust-lang-deprecated/rustc-serialize/issues
Patched
no patched versions

Description

rustc-serialize will no longer be maintained as declared by the developer. By fuzzing the package, we can identify multiple vulnerabilities. The project has been archived and cannot submit issues. The developer has recommended using the serde crate instead.

Advisory available under CC0-1.0 license.
